newsitem.title: CANADA: Toronto stocks tick lower at open despite golds.
newsitem.headline: Toronto stocks tick lower at open despite golds.

text.p: * Toronto stock market lost a bit of ground at Monday's open, following New York lower despite a strong gain in golds. * Only 7 million shares traded worth C$84 million.
Toronto stocks opened softer in lackluster dealings on Monday, hurt by reignited concerns over a possible hike in North American interest rates.
"The interest rate concerns ... dominate the scene," said Maison Placements Canada President John Ing. "The environment is a lot more unfriendly."
If short-term interest rates were raised in the U.S., investors would be more likely to pour their funds into bonds and withdraw from stocks, analysts said.
Another situation prompting nervousness is the currency problem in Thailand which could spread wider, Ing said.
